about_the_game:
The "Odyssey of Fantasy Series Enemy Material Collection" is a collection of materials to highly suitable for a high fantasy setting. This collection contains over 45 different types of enemies, including goblins, orcs, and dragons, as well as species such as Ents, golems, fairies, and dungeons parts that would be useful to create high fantasy game scenarios.

*******************************************
enemies ： 46 items (including differential designs)
sv_enemies : 46 items (including differential designs)
*******************************************

-Variations of Race and Species
Includes different types of variations for each creature race, such as Regular, Warrior, Wizard, Archer, General, King, and more, making each race feeling realistic and user-friendly in terms of lore expansion.

-Five Magical Attributes
“Odyssey of Fantasy” series are designed with The Five Magical Elements of fire, water, wood, light, and darkness in mind. Every fairy, elemental, and wizard are associated with these five attributes so users can assign them to different habitats for deeper worldbuilding.

-Combine with default materials to expand your worldview
This DLC is created in accordance with RPG Maker MZ's default materials' standards and design themes, making mix-matching a viable option. Alternatively, users can also choose to combine with the "Odyssey of Fantasy Series Battle Background Materials" to depict a detailed and consistent high fantasy world.

*******************************************
The materials can also be used to create games using other Maker series, but they will need to be modified using graphics editing software or other tools. Thank you for your understanding.


・This pack is for use in Maker Series ONLY
・OK to be used in Commercial projects made in RPG Maker
・You may modify some of the assets (but not redistribute them) for your own game use only.
・All copyrights, neighboring rights, and all other rights to this material belong to the creator or a third party authorized by the creator.
